description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
name: Excel 2016 - Level 1
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:09.558
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:09.558 --> 00:00:13.159
Hello, we're here to introduce you to
a new series that we're beginning on

3
00:00:13.159 --> 00:00:14.520
Microsoft Excel 2016.

4
00:00:14.520 --> 00:00:18.110
I'm here with Mike Roderick
who's gonna help us

5
00:00:18.110 --> 00:00:20.070
understand what we'll be
learning in this series.

6
00:00:20.070 --> 00:00:23.160
Mike Yeah,
we're gonna be covering Excel from top

7
00:00:23.160 --> 00:00:25.780
to bottom really from a couple
different perspectives.

8
00:00:25.780 --> 00:00:28.990
These videos that we're getting ready
to shoot are gonna help those of you

9
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:31.030
that are getting started in Excel.

10
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:32.760
Maybe you've gotten a new job and

11
00:00:32.760 --> 00:00:37.140
you need to learn how to use Excel because
it's part of your job requirements.

12
00:00:37.140 --> 00:00:40.340
We're also gonna be covering a lot
of the objectives that are for

13
00:00:40.340 --> 00:00:41.550
the Microsoft exam.

14
00:00:41.550 --> 00:00:46.340
You can go out and get certified in Excel
to prove your knowledge to your employer.

15
00:00:46.340 --> 00:00:50.740
So we're gonna hit it from both angles
there, trying to cover everybody's needs.

16
00:00:50.740 --> 00:00:51.920
And we're gonna cover,

17
00:00:51.920 --> 00:00:55.690
these are basically the first series
of videos that we're gonna do.

18
00:00:55.690 --> 00:00:59.070
We're gonna start with the basics,
we're gonna learn how to simply create

19
00:00:59.070 --> 00:01:03.270
worksheets and workbooks and
navigate around that user interface so

20
00:01:03.270 --> 00:01:06.070
that I feel comfortable
Working with Excel.

21
00:01:06.070 --> 00:01:11.010
We're gonna look at inserting
things like hyperlinks and

22
00:01:11.010 --> 00:01:14.330
changing worksheet order and
coloring tabs.

23
00:01:14.330 --> 00:01:17.170
We'll move on then from that
to formatting our worksheets.

24
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.430
Once I've got that data inserted into a
worksheet, I've gotta make it presentable

25
00:01:21.430 --> 00:01:24.800
so I can turn in back in to my
superiors or take it to a meeting.

26
00:01:24.800 --> 00:01:26.490
How do I make it look good, right?

27
00:01:26.490 --> 00:01:28.860
How do I get my columns lined up right?

28
00:01:28.860 --> 00:01:32.770
How do I get the text, the right font and
underlined, or what have you.

29
00:01:32.770 --> 00:01:34.210
We're gonna cover all of that.

30
00:01:34.210 --> 00:01:37.040
We're gonna look at things like
data validation to make sure that

31
00:01:37.040 --> 00:01:41.570
when data is entered into this worksheet,
that it's in the correct format.

32
00:01:41.570 --> 00:01:46.590
We're gonna take a look at different
options and views that we can configure.

33
00:01:46.590 --> 00:01:49.630
Hiding worksheets,
hiding columns and rows,

34
00:01:51.010 --> 00:01:55.930
we're gonna take a brief look at macros,
recording some simple macros that allow me

35
00:01:55.930 --> 00:02:00.750
to automate some of my routine tasks
that I have to do and then we're gonna

36
00:02:00.750 --> 00:02:05.130
take a look at how we can print workbooks
and how we cans ave those workbooks and

37
00:02:05.130 --> 00:02:08.530
make sure that they're available for
other people to access.

38
00:02:08.530 --> 00:02:09.670
Or if I need a hard copy,

39
00:02:09.670 --> 00:02:12.910
how do I print just this one
worksheet out of this workbook?

40
00:02:12.910 --> 00:02:16.190
Or how do I print a specific
area of a worksheet?

41
00:02:16.190 --> 00:02:19.760
And then we're gonna dive
into formatting cells, right?

42
00:02:19.760 --> 00:02:24.350
Making sure that currency is formatted
with a dollar sign and decimal points and

43
00:02:24.350 --> 00:02:26.680
that dates show up properly.

44
00:02:26.680 --> 00:02:30.970
We'll take a look at creating groups and
outlines to summarize our data and

45
00:02:30.970 --> 00:02:33.970
give us that summary
information that we need.

46
00:02:33.970 --> 00:02:38.722
We also take a look at things like
sparklines and charts and inserting

47
00:02:38.722 --> 00:02:44.375
smart art and other objects that gives me
the visual representation for the data.

48
00:02:44.375 --> 00:02:48.795
They give me another way to look at it
that make it possible to spot trends and

49
00:02:48.795 --> 00:02:50.695
anomalies in my data.

50
00:02:50.695 --> 00:02:53.525
Also taking a look at tables, right?

51
00:02:53.525 --> 00:02:58.455
Tables are a great part of Excel,
a great way to organize my data,

52
00:02:58.455 --> 00:03:01.375
filter my data, sort my data.

53
00:03:01.375 --> 00:03:04.065
And then we take a look at functions,
of course.

54
00:03:04.065 --> 00:03:06.835
Because that's gonna be a big
part of working with Excel.

55
00:03:06.835 --> 00:03:09.340
We can put these raw numbers in there, but

56
00:03:09.340 --> 00:03:13.480
I need to be able to figure out sums and
averages and counts.

57
00:03:13.480 --> 00:03:14.960
We're gonna cover all that for you.

58
00:03:14.960 --> 00:03:19.677
So, if you are in a position where you
need to use Excel as part of your everyday

59
00:03:19.677 --> 00:03:24.468
job or if you're studying up to take one
of those Microsoft specialist exams,

60
00:03:24.468 --> 00:03:26.806
these are gonna be the videos for you.

61
00:03:26.806 --> 00:03:33.229
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
episodes.title: Introduction to Excel 2016

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike start to show us how to create a basic workbook using various methods in Excel.  These methods will help us to get up and working quickly, as the guys demonstrate.  They show how to create a blank workbook, how to create workbook from pre-made templates and even by importing data directly into an Excel workbook.  All of these methods really do lend to someone starting with excel to realize the power of excel to improve your productivity.
episodes.title: Creating Workbooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike help us to see the navigation feature that are built into Excel 2016.  Even though we can manually navigate around using the mouse or arrow keys, Mike shows how to use the Find tool as well as the Name Box to quickly navigate through large datasets within an Excel 2016 workbook.
episodes.title: Creating Workbooks Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike help us with making our worksheets presentable.  They remind us that seeing the data is not enough.  Data must be presented in a manner that will help to make the point with our data the way we need, according to the guys.  Mike demonstrates how to make the worksheets look better through adjusting the page setup, adjusting the column or row height to make it more effective and adding in additional rows when data is already present.  These techniques are key to formatting data for presentation as well productivity.
episodes.title: Format Worksheets

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue to show us more tools to make the data we use in Excel 2016 is presentable.  They demonstrate how to change theme within a worksheet and insert a watermark.  They discuss the effective use of headers and footers and how to set them for a workbook.  Lastly, they show the importance of setting data validation for inputting data.
episodes.title: Formatting Worksheets Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike take some time to help us break out of using Excel 2016 default settings.  They talk about show us the benefits of hiding column, roles and even worksheets.  Also reminding us that this is not a security feature but can help when needing to only display or print certain columns of a worksheet without displaying everything.  When working with large worksheets, using split view and freeze panes can help keep track of data easier, according to Mike and Ronnie.  They also show where to effect the workbook properties to make it easier to find the workbook without having to examine the contents
episodes.title: Customizing Views

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike introduce us to more ways to become more efficient when working with Excel 2016.  Productivity and Efficiency and keys to working better with Excel.  They show us how to customize the ribbon and the quick access toolbar (QAT).  They emphasize how customizing these tools makes working in Excel more intuitive for the user.  The guys emphasize the use of Macros within the workbook and the need to secure them too since macros can be changed easily and run not only within that excel workbook but the commands can affect the entire computer system.
episodes.title: Customizing Views Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike talk about the importance of saving and printing with Excel 2016.  They guide us through some of the different options we have for saving an Excel file in a different format to make the data more accessible to people who may not use excel.  While printing is not difficult, setting up to print what we want to print has many more options that can make it a little more complex so Mike shows us some of the printing options available including setting a print area and setting print scaling as well as adding in information into the headers and footers.  They close out of the show by talking about the benefits of saving to remote locations.
episodes.title: Printing and Saving

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike show us how to work with inserting data into our workbooks.  Even though we can manually enter data, the data may already exist in a different workbook, or be entered incorrectly or located elsewhere in the same workbook, the guys show us how use the powerful tools in excel to help us to insert the data where it needs to be.  Mike demonstrates multiple tools such as ‘Find and Replace’, ‘Copy and Paste’, ‘autofill’ and couple of others to demonstrate the power of excel when dealing with data.
episodes.title: Inserting Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike show us how to format the data for presentation.  They show how to change fonts, numbering formats and even apply cell styles.  Using these tools and others, helps to show the data in the context we need it.  They show some of the power of the tools in excel to help provide that emphasis and the context that is needed.
episodes.title: Formatting Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike take some time to help us to group and sort the data.  They show that understanding the basics of grouping and sorting results in reporting exactly what is asked of us.  They remind us that though formulas and details are foundations of the results we need, grouping and sorting helps to present that data in the way that is expected.  They guys demonstrate the use of conditional formatting, transposing put the data into perspective.  Using the sparklines, outlines and subtotals show that we command of presenting the data as requested.  These are great skills that anyone proficient in Excel should know how to accomplish.
episodes.title: Order and Group Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike show how to create tables and use the power of tables when dealing with data.   They demonstrate the ease of creating a table using the built in tools and show how to use those table tools to get the data results we are looking for quickly and dynamically.  These features provide benefits to working with very large sets of data.   The guys also show how you can use tables to sort the logical data set to help with the reporting and display of the data.
episodes.title: Creating Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike introduce us to the fundamentals of building formulas.  They discuss the uses of relative references in formulas and absolute reference.  The guys also talk about the order of operations and it’s importance to being able to see the data we need.  Understanding the way that excel creates the formula is extremely helpful as our data and calculated values become more complex.
episodes.title: Ranges and References

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike talk about using text functions to help make text values more consistent.  Mike uses these functions to help with data inconsistencies.  The guys show us how to extract data from cells as well as link multiple data values to report as a single value.
episodes.title: Sums and Conditional Logic

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike talk about using text functions to help make text values more consistent.  Mike uses these functions to help with data inconsistencies.  The guys show us how to extract data from cells as well as link multiple data values to report as a single value.
episodes.title: Text Functions

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike introduce the use of charts in Excel workbooks.  They emphasize that charts help to display the data visually making it easier to make business decision.  Mike demonstrates how Excel 2016 has tools to build charts quickly and effectively.  The guys take some time to show some of the different changes that anyone can use to modify the chart to format it for the proper impact.
episodes.title: Creating Charts

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike show how to add different elements into an Excel spreadsheet to enhance the presentation of the data. Mike shows how to insert Smart Art to change the impact that data has on spreadsheet.  He also shows how to insert shapes and formatting those shapes to help us to make our data appear the way we want it.
episodes.title: Inserting Objects
